prompts: Each person shares one sentence that states what you want to learn and what you can teach.
What do you know well enough to teach tomorrow, practically, not theoretically?
What are you actively learning right now, and why now?
What is one underused resource you have, access, dataset, community, tools, or experience?
What is one topic you have unusually strong opinions about because experience taught you?
Someone volunteer to explain a concept most people get wrong, then the group asks where it breaks.
What is your favorite test for understanding X, and what edge case would improve that test?
Share a mistake you made and the lesson, then the group extracts a general rule and a warning sign.
What is the beginner trap in your field, and what practice exercise helps avoid it?
What is the most useful template or checklist you have used, or wish existed?
Pick one personâ€™s 30-day goal, then the group proposes three experiments they could run this week.
Name the constraint, time, confidence, access, or feedback, then each person proposes one workaround.
What would make today a win, and what specific next step plus deadline would create that win?
What is the smallest milestone that proves progress in 7 days, and what metric defines it?
What support structure do you need, practice partner, reviews, or accountability, and who in the group can help?
If this group had 2 hours, what would we ship, solve, or draft, and which one do we choose?
What resource could we create that would help others, repo, reading list, or checklist, and what is the outline?
Where are we unusually picky about quality, and what standard should we adopt?
What micro collaboration can we do in the next week, and who does what role?
End the round by naming one person you want to follow up with and why, in one sentence.
